snippet: Lawmakers Tuesday called for new laws to ensure federal oversight of the type of pharmacy that made the medicine that has so far killed 11 people in a national outbreak of meningitis.
abstract: Lawmakers call for new laws to ensure federal oversight of the type of pharmacy that made the medicine that has so far killed 11 people in a national outbreak of meningitis; 119 people have been affected, all of them injected with a steroid shipped from Massachusetts pharmacy New England Compounding Center.

byline.contributor: Denise Grady and Jess Bidgood contributed reporting. Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Lawmakers Tuesday called for new laws to ensure federal oversight of the type of pharmacy that made the medicine that has so far killed 11 people in a national outbreak of meningitis.

headline.main: Lawmakers Focus on Small Drug Makers as Meningitis Death Toll Rises
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Focus on Oversight of Small Drugmakers as Meningitis Death Toll Rises
